trans-unit.source: Deploy a web app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Deploy a web app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Learn what methods are available for deploying content to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn what methods are available for deploying content to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: You have many options for deploying your own content to <linkText>App Service Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You have many options for deploying your own content to <linkText>App Service Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides a brief overview of each option and links to more information.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides a brief overview of each option and links to more information.

trans-unit.source: The best way to deploy a web app is to set up a <linkText>continuous delivery workflow</linkText><title></title> integrated with your <linkText>source control system</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The best way to deploy a web app is to set up a <linkText>continuous delivery workflow</linkText><title></title> integrated with your <linkText>source control system</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Automation not only makes the development process more efficient but also can make your backup and restore processes more manageable and reliable.
trans-unit.target: Automation not only makes the development process more efficient but also can make your backup and restore processes more manageable and reliable.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have source control set up yet, the easiest way to get started is to use a cloud-hosted source control system.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have source control set up yet, the easiest way to get started is to use a cloud-hosted source control system.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio Online</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio Online</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Repository websites using Git</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Repository websites using Git</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Repository websites using Mercurial</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Repository websites using Mercurial</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dropbox</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dropbox</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>WebMatrix</linkText><title></title> are Microsoft IDEs (integrated development environments) that you can use for web development.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>WebMatrix</linkText><title></title> are Microsoft IDEs (integrated development environments) that you can use for web development.

trans-unit.source: Both provide built-in features that make it easy to deploy a web app.
trans-unit.target: Both provide built-in features that make it easy to deploy a web app.

trans-unit.source: Both can use <linkText>Web Deploy</linkText><title></title> to automate additional deployment-related tasks such as database deployment and connection string changes.
trans-unit.target: Both can use <linkText>Web Deploy</linkText><title></title> to automate additional deployment-related tasks such as database deployment and connection string changes.

trans-unit.source: Both can also deploy by using [FTP or FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FileTransferProtocol)).
trans-unit.target: Both can also deploy by using [FTP or FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FileTransferProtocol)).

trans-unit.source: WebMatrix is quick to install and easy to learn, but Visual Studio offers many more features for working with Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: WebMatrix is quick to install and easy to learn, but Visual Studio offers many more features for working with Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: From within the Visual Studio IDE you can create, stop, start, and delete web apps, you can view logs as they are created in real-time, you can debug remotely, and much more.
trans-unit.target: From within the Visual Studio IDE you can create, stop, start, and delete web apps, you can view logs as they are created in real-time, you can debug remotely, and much more.

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio also integrates with source control systems such as <linkText>Visual Studio Online</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Team Foundation Server</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>Git repositories</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio also integrates with source control systems such as <linkText>Visual Studio Online</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>Team Foundation Server</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>Git repositories</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Regardless of what IDE you use, you can also deploy content to your App by using [FTP](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FileTransferProtocol) to copy files.
trans-unit.target: Regardless of what IDE you use, you can also deploy content to your App by using [FTP](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FileTransferProtocol) to copy files.

trans-unit.source: It's easy to create FTP credentials for a web app, and you can use them in any application that works with FTP, including browsers such as Internet Explorer and full-featured free utilities such as <linkText>FileZilla</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It's easy to create FTP credentials for a web app, and you can use them in any application that works with FTP, including browsers such as Internet Explorer and full-featured free utilities such as <linkText>FileZilla</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Web Apps also supports the more secure FTPS protocol.
trans-unit.target: Web Apps also supports the more secure FTPS protocol.

trans-unit.source: Although it's easy to copy your web app's files to Azure using FTP utilities, they don't automatically take care of or coordinate related deployment tasks such as deploying a database or changing connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Although it's easy to copy your web app's files to Azure using FTP utilities, they don't automatically take care of or coordinate related deployment tasks such as deploying a database or changing connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Also, many FTP tools don't compare source and destination files in order to skip copying files that haven't changed.
trans-unit.target: Also, many FTP tools don't compare source and destination files in order to skip copying files that haven't changed.

trans-unit.source: For large Apps, always copying all files can result in long deployment times even for minor updates since all files are always copied.
trans-unit.target: For large Apps, always copying all files can result in long deployment times even for minor updates since all files are always copied.

trans-unit.source: If you are using TFS, Git, or Mercurial in an on-premises (not cloud-hosted) repository, you can deploy directly from your repository to a web app.
trans-unit.target: If you are using TFS, Git, or Mercurial in an on-premises (not cloud-hosted) repository, you can deploy directly from your repository to a web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Team Foundation Server (TFS)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Team Foundation Server (TFS)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>On-premises Git or Mercurial repositories</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>On-premises Git or Mercurial repositories</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: It's always best to automate your development workflow, but if you can't do that directly in your source control system, you can set it up manually by using command-line tools.
trans-unit.target: It's always best to automate your development workflow, but if you can't do that directly in your source control system, you can set it up manually by using command-line tools.

trans-unit.source: This generally involves the use of more than one tool or framework, as deployment often involves performing site management functions as well as copying content.
trans-unit.target: This generally involves the use of more than one tool or framework, as deployment often involves performing site management functions as well as copying content.

trans-unit.source: Azure simplifies site management tasks that you might have to do for deployment by providing a REST management API and several frameworks that make it easier to work with the API.
trans-unit.target: Azure simplifies site management tasks that you might have to do for deployment by providing a REST management API and several frameworks that make it easier to work with the API.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>FTP</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>FTP</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>MSBuild</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>FTP scripts</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>.NET management API</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Command-Line Interface (Azure CLI)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Web Deploy command line</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Octopus Deploy</linkText><title></title> can be used with App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Octopus Deploy</linkText><title></title> can be used with App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Deploy ASP.NET applications to Azure Web Sites</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Deploy ASP.NET applications to Azure Web Sites</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio Online</linkText><title></title> (formerly Team Foundation Service) is Microsoft's cloud-based solution for source control and team collaboration.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio Online</linkText><title></title> (formerly Team Foundation Service) is Microsoft's cloud-based solution for source control and team collaboration.

trans-unit.source: The service is free for a team of up to 5 developers.
trans-unit.target: The service is free for a team of up to 5 developers.

trans-unit.source: You can do continuous delivery to a web app in App Services, and your repository can use either <linkText>Git or TFVC</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can do continuous delivery to a web app in App Services, and your repository can use either <linkText>Git or TFVC</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and TFVC</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and TFVC</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step tutorial that shows how to set up continuous delivery from Visual Studio Online to a web app, using TFVC.
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step tutorial that shows how to set up continuous delivery from Visual Studio Online to a web app, using TFVC.

trans-unit.source: TFVC is the centralized source control option, as opposed to Git, which is the distributed source control option.
trans-unit.target: TFVC is the centralized source control option, as opposed to Git, which is the distributed source control option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and Git</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continuous delivery to Azure using Visual Studio Online and Git</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Similar to the previous tutorial but uses Git instead of TFVC.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the previous tutorial but uses Git instead of TFVC.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Git</linkText><title></title> is a popular distributed source control system.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Git</linkText><title></title> is a popular distributed source control system.

trans-unit.source: Azure has built-in features that make it easy to automate deployment to a web app from popular web-based repository sites that store Git repositories, including <linkText>GitHub</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>CodePlex</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>BitBucket</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure has built-in features that make it easy to automate deployment to a web app from popular web-based repository sites that store Git repositories, including <linkText>GitHub</linkText><title></title>, <linkText>CodePlex</linkText><title></title>, and <linkText>BitBucket</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: An advantage of using Git to deploy is that it's relatively easy to roll back to an earlier deployment if that ever becomes necessary.
trans-unit.target: An advantage of using Git to deploy is that it's relatively easy to roll back to an earlier deployment if that ever becomes necessary.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: How to use Git to publish directly from your local computer to Web Apps (in Azure, this method of publishing is called Local Git).
trans-unit.target: How to use Git to publish directly from your local computer to Web Apps (in Azure, this method of publishing is called Local Git).

trans-unit.source: Also shows how to enable continuous deployment of Git repositories from GitHub, CodePlex, or BitBucket.
trans-unit.target: Also shows how to enable continuous deployment of Git repositories from GitHub, CodePlex, or BitBucket.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploying to Web Apps with GitHub using Kudu</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploying to Web Apps with GitHub using Kudu</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Video by Scott Hanselman and David Ebbo that shows how to deploy a web app directly from GitHub to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Video by Scott Hanselman and David Ebbo that shows how to deploy a web app directly from GitHub to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy to Azure Button for Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy to Azure Button for Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Blog about a method for triggering deployment from a Git repository.
trans-unit.target: Blog about a method for triggering deployment from a Git repository.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you use <linkText>Mercurial</linkText><title></title> as your source control system and store your repository in <linkText>CodePlex</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>BitBucket</linkText><title></title>, you can use built-in features in Azure App Service to automatically deploy your content.
trans-unit.target: If you use <linkText>Mercurial</linkText><title></title> as your source control system and store your repository in <linkText>CodePlex</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>BitBucket</linkText><title></title>, you can use built-in features in Azure App Service to automatically deploy your content.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to deploy using Mercurial, see the following resources:
trans-unit.target: For information about how to deploy using Mercurial, see the following resources:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Although this tutorial shows how to publish a Git repository, the process for Mercurial repositories hosted in CodePlex or BitBucket is similar.
trans-unit.target: Although this tutorial shows how to publish a Git repository, the process for Mercurial repositories hosted in CodePlex or BitBucket is similar.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Forum for Git, Mercurial, and Dropbox</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dropbox</linkText><title></title> is not a source control system, but if you store your source code in Dropbox you can automate deployment from your Dropbox account.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dropbox</linkText><title></title> is not a source control system, but if you store your source code in Dropbox you can automate deployment from your Dropbox account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Deploy To Web Apps from Dropbox</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Deploy To Web Apps from Dropbox</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: How to use the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title> to set up Dropbox deployment.
trans-unit.target: How to use the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title> to set up Dropbox deployment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Dropbox Deployment to Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Dropbox Deployment to Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This video walks through the process of connecting a Dropbox folder to a web app and shows how quickly you can get a web app up and running or maintain it using simple drag-and-drop deployment.
trans-unit.target: This video walks through the process of connecting a Dropbox folder to a web app and shows how quickly you can get a web app up and running or maintain it using simple drag-and-drop deployment.

trans-unit.source: A basic introduction to web deployment using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: A basic introduction to web deployment using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Dated but includes information that is still relevant, including an overview of options for deploying a database along with the web application and a list of additional deployment tasks you might have to do or manually configure Visual Studio to do for you.
trans-unit.target: Dated but includes information that is still relevant, including an overview of options for deploying a database along with the web application and a list of additional deployment tasks you might have to do or manually configure Visual Studio to do for you.

trans-unit.source: This topic is about deployment in general, not just about deployment to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: This topic is about deployment in general, not just about deployment to Web Apps.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>ASP.NET Web Deployment using Visual Studio</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A 12-part tutorial series that covers a more complete range of deployment tasks than the others in this list.
trans-unit.target: A 12-part tutorial series that covers a more complete range of deployment tasks than the others in this list.

trans-unit.source: Some Azure deployment features have been added since the tutorial was written, but notes added later explain what's missing.
trans-unit.target: Some Azure deployment features have been added since the tutorial was written, but notes added later explain what's missing.

trans-unit.target: Explains how to deploy an ASP.NET web project in Visual Studio, using the Git plug-in to commit the code to Git and connecting Azure to the Git repository.

trans-unit.source: Starting in Visual Studio 2013, Git support is built-in an doesn't require installation of a plug-in.
trans-unit.target: Starting in Visual Studio 2013, Git support is built-in an doesn't require installation of a plug-in.

trans-unit.source: Team Foundation Server is Microsoft's on-premises solution for source control and team collaboration.
trans-unit.target: Team Foundation Server is Microsoft's on-premises solution for source control and team collaboration.

trans-unit.source: You can set up TFS to do continuous delivery to a web app.
trans-unit.target: You can set up TFS to do continuous delivery to a web app.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Continuous Delivery for Cloud Services in Azure</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This document is for an Azure Cloud Service, but some of its content is relevant to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: This document is for an Azure Cloud Service, but some of its content is relevant to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: In Azure you can enter the URL of any repository that uses Git or Mercurial in order to deploy from that location.
trans-unit.target: In Azure you can enter the URL of any repository that uses Git or Mercurial in order to deploy from that location.

trans-unit.source: You can also directly push from a local Git repository to a web app.
trans-unit.target: You can also directly push from a local Git repository to a web app.

trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resources:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Publishing from Source Control to Web Apps with Git</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: How to use Git to publish directly from your local computer to a web app (in Azure, this method of publishing is called Local Git).

trans-unit.target: Also shows how to enable continuous deployment of Git repositories from GitHub, CodePlex, or BitBucket.

trans-unit.source: Blog post by Scott Hanselman.
trans-unit.target: Blog post by Scott Hanselman.

trans-unit.source: If you use the <linkText>Visual Studio IDE</linkText><title></title> for development, you can use <linkText>MSBuild</linkText><title></title> to automate anything you can do in your IDE.
trans-unit.target: If you use the <linkText>Visual Studio IDE</linkText><title></title> for development, you can use <linkText>MSBuild</linkText><title></title> to automate anything you can do in your IDE.

trans-unit.source: You can configure MSBuild to use either <linkText>Web Deploy</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>FTP/FTPS</linkText><title></title> to copy files.
trans-unit.target: You can configure MSBuild to use either <linkText>Web Deploy</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>FTP/FTPS</linkText><title></title> to copy files.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy can also automate many other deployment-related tasks, such as deploying databases.
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy can also automate many other deployment-related tasks, such as deploying databases.

trans-unit.target: For more information about command-line deployment using MSBuild, see the following resources:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>ASP.NET Web Deployment using Visual Studio: Command Line Deployment</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Tenth in a series of tutorials about deployment to Azure using Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Tenth in a series of tutorials about deployment to Azure using Visual Studio.

trans-unit.target: Shows how to use the command line to deploy after setting up publish profiles in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Inside the Microsoft Build Engine: Using MSBuild and Team Foundation Build</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Hard-copy book that includes chapters on how to use MSBuild for deployment.
trans-unit.target: Hard-copy book that includes chapters on how to use MSBuild for deployment.

trans-unit.source: It's easy to create [FTP/FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FileTransferProtocol) credentials for a web app, and you can then use those credentials with FTP batch scripts.
trans-unit.target: It's easy to create [FTP/FTPS](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FileTransferProtocol) credentials for a web app, and you can then use those credentials with FTP batch scripts.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Using FTP Batch Scripts</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Using FTP Batch Scripts</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can perform MSBuild or FTP deployment functions from <linkText>Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can perform MSBuild or FTP deployment functions from <linkText>Windows PowerShell</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you do that, you can also use a collection of Windows PowerShell cmdlets that make the Azure REST management API easy to call.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, you can also use a collection of Windows PowerShell cmdlets that make the Azure REST management API easy to call.

trans-unit.source: E-book chapter that explains how the sample application shown in the e-book uses Windows PowerShell scripts to create an Azure test environment and deploy to it.
trans-unit.target: E-book chapter that explains how the sample application shown in the e-book uses Windows PowerShell scripts to create an Azure test environment and deploy to it.

trans-unit.target: How to use Windows PowerShell deployment scripts that Visual Studio generates.

trans-unit.source: You can write C# code to perform MSBuild or FTP functions for deployment.
trans-unit.target: You can write C# code to perform MSBuild or FTP functions for deployment.

trans-unit.source: If you do that, you can access the Azure management REST API to perform site management functions.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, you can access the Azure management REST API to perform site management functions.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Automating everything with the Azure Management Libraries and .NET</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Automating everything with the Azure Management Libraries and .NET</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Introduction to the .NET management API and links to more documentation.
trans-unit.target: Introduction to the .NET management API and links to more documentation.

trans-unit.source: You can use the command line in Windows, Mac or Linux machines to deploy by using FTP.
trans-unit.target: You can use the command line in Windows, Mac or Linux machines to deploy by using FTP.

trans-unit.source: If you do that, you can also access the Azure REST management API using the Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: If you do that, you can also access the Azure REST management API using the Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Command line tools</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Command line tools</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Portal page in Azure.com for command line tool information.
trans-unit.target: Portal page in Azure.com for command line tool information.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Web Deploy</linkText><title></title> is Microsoft software for deployment to IIS that not only provides intelligent file sync features but also can perform or coordinate many other deployment-related tasks that can't be automated when you use FTP.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Web Deploy</linkText><title></title> is Microsoft software for deployment to IIS that not only provides intelligent file sync features but also can perform or coordinate many other deployment-related tasks that can't be automated when you use FTP.

trans-unit.source: For example, Web Deploy can deploy a new database or database updates along with your web app.
trans-unit.target: For example, Web Deploy can deploy a new database or database updates along with your web app.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy can also minimize the time required to update an existing site since it can intelligently copy only changed files.
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy can also minimize the time required to update an existing site since it can intelligently copy only changed files.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft WebMatrix, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Online, and Team Foundation Server have support for Web Deploy built-in, but you can also use Web Deploy directly from the command line to automate deployment.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft WebMatrix, Visual Studio, Visual Studio Online, and Team Foundation Server have support for Web Deploy built-in, but you can also use Web Deploy directly from the command line to automate deployment.

trans-unit.source: Web Deploy commands are very powerful but the learning curve can be steep.
trans-unit.target: Web Deploy commands are very powerful but the learning curve can be steep.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the following resource:
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the following resource:

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Simple Web Apps: Deployment</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: MSBuild is the build engine used by Visual Studio, and it can also be used from the command line to deploy web applications to Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: MSBuild is the build engine used by Visual Studio, and it can also be used from the command line to deploy web applications to Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial is part of a series that is mainly about Visual Studio deployment.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is part of a series that is mainly about Visual Studio deployment.

trans-unit.source: In some scenarios you might want to be able to easily switch back and forth between a staging and a production version of your web app.
trans-unit.target: In some scenarios you might want to be able to easily switch back and forth between a staging and a production version of your web app.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Staged Deployment on Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Staged Deployment on Web Apps</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Having a backup and restore plan in place is an important part of any deployment workflow.
trans-unit.target: Having a backup and restore plan in place is an important part of any deployment workflow.

trans-unit.source: For information about the Web Apps backup and restore feature, see <linkText>Web Apps Backups</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the Web Apps backup and restore feature, see <linkText>Web Apps Backups</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For information about how to use Azure's Role-Based Access Control to manage access to Web Apps deployment, see <linkText>RBAC and Web App Publishing</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For information about how to use Azure's Role-Based Access Control to manage access to Web Apps deployment, see <linkText>RBAC and Web App Publishing</linkText><title></title>.
